intro: Antiphytum floribundum, commonly known as the flowering antiphytum, is a unique plant with distinctive botanical features. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, adding to its ornamental value. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Antiphytum floribundum is native to specific regions in South America and thrives in well-drained soil with moderate sunlight.
